intro: Dipcadi platyphyllum, commonly known as the flat-leaved squill, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features a bulbous stem and produces clusters of white or pale blue flowers with six petals. Its leaves are broad and flat, contributing to its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
